intro: Senecio mutisii, commonly known as the Mexican groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to survive in dry environments. Its yellow flowers bloom in summer, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Senecio mutisii is often found in scrublands and is considered a species of conservation concern due to habitat loss.
